title: Atrax
author: Atrax
content: Maybe I'm not at the right place with this sub, but couldn't think of a better one.Here's the issue: A small nursery was doing some crowd-funding. In the process, I was able to bid for the baptism of a new rose variety. What should be the name of this new variety? "Satoshi Famosa?" "Bitcoin Florensis?" Or does anyone have any ideas?

comments.author: Mbitr
comments.body: Quote from: Atrax on May 06, 2023, 09:20:07 AMMaybe I'm not at the right place with this sub, but couldn't think of a better one.Yep, not sure where this topic would go.But what a great idea and very cool thing you’ve done. Another good bit of Bitcoin promotion How about something like  Rosa Bitcoinius ? Anyway, again - awesome work

comments.author: Wiwo
comments.body: Quote from: Mbitr on May 06, 2023, 09:47:50 AMQuote from: Atrax on May 06, 2023, 09:20:07 AMMaybe I'm not at the right place with this sub, but couldn't think of a better one.Yep, not sure where this topic would go.But what a great idea and very cool thing you’ve done. Another good bit of Bitcoin promotion How about something like  Rosa Bitcoinius ? Anyway, again - awesome work  I hard a similar situation when a church I'm my local region was doing crown funding to erect a new signpost and I offer to spend some Bitcoin in funding the project, and guess what Bitcoin logo was encrypted within the space where there was project courtesy so what I did basically was to write my name and bitcologo. Only I know what exactly that means and some other few friends who were around when the design was done, nice one ops and I suggest you go with your original ideas but good you shared them here for us to read.

comments.author: Framelover
comments.body: Quote from: Atrax on May 06, 2023, 09:20:07 AMMaybe I'm not at the right place with this sub, but couldn't think of a better one.Here's the issue: A small nursery was doing some crowd-funding. In the process, I was able to bid for the baptism of a new rose variety. What should be the name of this new variety? "Satoshi Famosa?" "Bitcoin Florensis?" Or does anyone have any ideas? It’s delightful to hear that you're lending your support to a small nursery and their crowdfunding campaign. Naming a new rose can be a fun and creative task! I like "Satoshi Famosa" and "Bitcoin Florensis" for their playful nod to cryptocurrency. Consider adding elements like color, scent, or unique characteristics of the rose to the name. Whatever you choose, I hope it brings joy to others.
